comments:
RHEL 4 update 2.
Run webservices wizard client to generate sample and select run on server. 
Then I got an error dialog saying the client URL is malformed.
And I click cancel on the dialog, and got the following stacktrace:
IWAB0358E Test client URL is malformed.
    org.eclipse.wst.common.environment.StatusException: IWAB0358E Test client URL is malformed.

Gil, could you please take a look?

Raymond indicated that this problem only occurs in Linux, not Windows.  The last time he had this working was the 0316 M driver.

He checked the version of the org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption plugin and it is v200602271844 for both the 0328M and 0316M driver.  

Actuall I don't think we release any changes to WTP 102 in the last 2 weeks.

Correct, we haven't changed anything in the last couple of weeks in 1.0.2. Only three fixes [1] have gone in, all between 2/27 and 3/15, and none anywhere near where the bug is occuring. I certainly won't dispute the appearance of a regression, but I don't think a code change in Web services is behind it.

Ramyond,
is there any significant difference in the root path to your workspace for your successful 3/16-based tests and not-so-successful 3/28-based test? The two most common causes of malformed URL issues we've encountered in the past are (1) having an incorrect number of '/' symbols after the scheme in Linux file: URIs and (2) incorrectly encoded spaces.

Gil,
please investigate right away.

[1] Bugs fixed in Web services in 1.0.2:
Bug 128094
Bug 128832
Bug 126757

The error message is a bit deceiving. The URL is being formed correctly but a PartInitException is thrown when we call:
browser.openURL(url);
and the message in the Exception is:
Could not launch external Web Browser for http://localhost:9081/q0403Client/sampleEchoProxy/TestClient.jsp. Check the Web Browser preferences.
When I manually launch the browser and paste the above URL in, the sample JSPs come up without problems.

Raymond,
Since the time this last worked and now, has anything changed with the default system browser settings on your installation of RedHat?

Thanks.
workspace path contains no spaces or double characters. No changes in browser settings since 3/16 build worked.

The bug can no longer be reproduced (even on the same machine and driver on which it was originally found). The few times early on I was able to reproduce it, it was clear that that the code in GSTCLaunchCommand was simply calling openURL with a valid URL on the default IWebBrowser obtained from IWorkbench. The URL was not malformed. Something strange seemed to be happening with the Eclipse browser support which made it incapable of launching the default system browser. The problem should be routed to the appropriate Eclipse component if it mysteriously "reappears".

Shouldn't this bug still be used to return the correct error message from WS in the case where no browser is configured and the platform throws the PartInitException? (at a lower severity of course) It sounded like WS was eating that error message.

Per Tim's suggestion, reopening this with a different summary and target milestone to handle the problem of the misleading error message being displayed by the Web services wizard. The fix involves a change to GSTCLaunchCommand in the catch clause for the PartInitException.

Created an attachment (id=38831)
apply to GSTCLaunchCommand.java in the org.eclipse.jst.ws.consumption.ui plugin

patch 1 of 1
The attached patch is ready to be committed.

This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP resolved bugs from the 1.0.x and 1.5.0 timeframe.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

Thanks, John Lanuti

traces.message: IWAB0358E Test client URL is malformed.
